page.title: 13ST MARGARET'S SCHOOL
page.content: St Margaret's School opened in 1955 as a primary school. Since then there have been 2 headmasters, Mr Baker and Mr Hofton. Mr Baker was at the school when it first opened and also served a time at the old school which is now the Angmering village library. There are 8 classes _ 3 infants and 5 junior. the school teaches all types of subjects except practical science experiements. The school roll is 200_250. The school's emblem is a Phoenix because a new school was built out of the "ashes" of the old one. The school's facilities include an outdoor heated swimming pool. The pupils have half an hour each day in it during the summer. Mayday is a tradition. The pupils dance in fancy dress round a Maypole.The school elects a May Queen and an attendant.
